title: Validator retry attestation when detected a future slot
body:
### Description

Validator is missing slots because the slot id is too high compared to the chain

Failed to produce aggregate  Slot: 6608897 Validator: [x]
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid params response from Beacon Node API (url = http://localhost:5051/eth/v1/validator/attestation_data?slot=6608897&committee_index=50, status = 400, message = Cannot create attestation for future slot. Requested 6608897 but current slot is 6608895)
at tech.pegasys.teku.validator.remote.typedef.ResponseHandler.defaultBadRequestHandler(ResponseHandler.java:129) ~[teku-validator-remote-23.5.0.jar:23.5.0]
at tech.pegasys.teku.validator.remote.typedef.ResponseHandler.handleResponse(ResponseHandler.java:93) ~[teku-validator-remote-23.5.0.jar:23.5.0]
at tech.pegasys.teku.validator.remote.typedef.handlers.AbstractTypeDefRequest.executeCall(AbstractTypeDefRequest.java:149) ~[teku-validator-remote-23.5.0.jar:23.5.0]

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)

Don't know why it's happening, maybe related to high cpu load / multithreading / timesync issue

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
attestation should be retried and not missed

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
attestation is missed

**Frequency:** [How regularly does it occur?] 
10-30 times a day

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: 23.5.0
* Java version: OpenJDK 19.0.2
* OS Name & Version: Win 10 Hyper-V VM

Hey there, thanks for raising this one.

It's a bit of a complicated scenario generally, where this would occur.

Some little notes:
 - attestations are due at 4 seconds into a given slot
 - blocks are due at 0 seconds on slot.

A number of things can happen, often regenerating states for example - where the beacon-node isn't ready to accept attestation requests, and this seems to be the most common kind of scenario where this 'future slot' error occurs.
It would be worth just making sure that your BN isn't running low on resources - that you're up to date on teku version etc etc.
It's also worth checking when it happens, whether the BN has any log context about anything - like slow tick events, regenerating states...

If the BN is struggling, it's difficult to resubmit, it could actually exacerbate any issues that may be happening on the BN, so resubmitting can be problematic...

We may be able to do something in this area, I'll have to ponder options...
